privacy_desc:
Alon Pardo, Attorney at Law ("we", "us") is the data controller for personal information collected through this website. We are committed to protecting your privacy and handling your data with the care it deserves.

privacy_scope: What We Collect  ·  Why & Legal Basis  ·  Sharing & Retention  ·  Your Rights
privacy_common_situations: Information you provide: Name, phone number, email address, case type, and message content submitted through our contact form.
WhatsApp communications: Phone number, name, and message content when you contact us via WhatsApp. These messages are processed by Meta Platforms in accordance with their own privacy policy.
Technical data collected automatically: IP address, browser type and version, device type, operating system, pages visited, time spent on pages, and referring URL.
Cookies and similar technologies: Essential cookies required for site functionality load automatically. We do not use third-party advertising or tracking cookies.
privacy_what_to_do_title: Why We Collect It & Legal Basis
privacy_what_to_do: Responding to inquiries: To review your message, assess your legal matter, and reply with next steps. Legal basis: your consent when submitting the form.

Providing legal services: To schedule consultations, prepare for meetings, and manage the attorney-client relationship. Legal basis: performance of a contract or pre-contractual steps taken at your request.
Site security and integrity: To prevent abuse, detect threats, and maintain the security of our systems. Legal basis: legitimate interest in protecting our website and users.
Analytics and improvement: To understand how visitors use the site and improve user experience. We collect only aggregated, non-identifying usage patterns. Legal basis: legitimate interest.
Legal compliance: To comply with applicable laws, regulations, and professional obligations under the Israel Bar Association rules. Legal basis: legal obligation.
Children: This website and our services are not directed at individuals under the age of 18. We do not knowingly collect personal data from minors.
privacy_how_i_help: Third-party service providers: We share data only with providers essential to operating this site — hosting (Replit/cloud provider), email delivery (Gmail SMTP via Nodemailer), and WhatsApp (Meta Platforms). We do not sell, rent, or trade your personal data.

International transfers: Some service providers may process data outside Israel. Where this occurs, we ensure appropriate safeguards are in place, including providers that adhere to recognised data protection frameworks.
Retention — inquiries: Contact form submissions and WhatsApp inquiry details are retained for up to 24 months from the date of last communication, after which they are securely deleted.
Retention — client files: If you become a client, your file is retained in accordance with Israel Bar Association regulations and applicable law (typically 7 years from the conclusion of the matter).
Retention — technical data: Server logs and analytics data are retained for up to 12 months. Backup copies are retained for 30 days.

Security measures: We protect your data using TLS encryption in transit, secure server infrastructure, rate limiting on form submissions, input validation, and restricted access controls. No system is completely secure, but we take reasonable and appropriate measures to safeguard your information.
privacy_services: Right of access: You may request a copy of the personal data we hold about you.
Right of correction: You may request that we correct inaccurate or incomplete data.
Right of deletion: You may request that we delete your personal data, subject to legal retention obligations.
Right to withdraw consent: Where processing is based on consent, you may withdraw it at any time. Withdrawal does not affect the lawfulness of prior processing.
Right to object: You may object to processing based on legitimate interests.
How to exercise your rights: Send your request to pardoal003@gmail.com. We will respond within 30 days.
Complaints: If you believe your privacy rights have been violated, you may file a complaint with the Israeli Privacy Protection Authority (PPA).

Changes to this policy: We may update this privacy policy from time to time. Any changes will be posted on this page with an updated revision date. We encourage you to review this policy periodically.

This policy explains what cookies are, how we use them on this website, and how you can manage your preferences. This site is operated by Alon Pardo, Attorney at Law.
Last updated: February 2026  ·  Contact: pardoal003@gmail.com
cookies_scope: What Are Cookies  ·  Cookies We Use  ·  Third Parties  ·  Your Choices
cookies_common_situations: Definition: Cookies are small text files that a website places on your device (computer, phone, or tablet) when you visit. They allow the site to recognise your device and remember certain information between visits.
Session cookies: Temporary cookies that are deleted when you close your browser. They are essential for basic site functionality such as navigation and form handling.
Persistent cookies: Cookies that remain on your device for a set period or until you delete them. They help remember your preferences — such as your selected language — across visits.
First-party vs. third-party: First-party cookies are set by this website directly. Third-party cookies are set by external services embedded in our pages (if any).
cookies_what_to_do: Strictly necessary cookies: These cookies are required for the website to function. They enable core features such as page navigation, form submission (contact form), and security. They cannot be disabled without breaking the site. No consent required.

Language preference: We store your language selection (Hebrew or English) so it persists as you navigate between pages. This is handled via the URL parameter and does not require a cookie, but your browser may cache this preference.

Rate limiting: Our server uses a short-lived identifier to enforce rate limits on the contact form (maximum 5 submissions per 15 minutes per IP address). This protects the site from abuse and does not track your browsing activity.

What we do NOT use: This website does not use advertising cookies, social media tracking pixels, remarketing tags, or any third-party analytics services (such as Google Analytics). We do not build user profiles or track you across other websites.
cookies_how_i_help: Google Fonts: This website loads fonts from Google Fonts. Google may receive your IP address and basic request data when fonts are downloaded. Google's privacy policy applies to this data processing. No cookies are set by Google Fonts.

WhatsApp (Meta Platforms): Our WhatsApp contact button links to wa.me. When you click it and open a conversation, Meta's privacy policy and cookie practices govern that interaction. No WhatsApp cookies are placed on this website.

Hosting provider: Our hosting infrastructure may set essential server-side cookies or log technical data (IP address, request timestamps) for security and operational purposes. This data is not used for tracking or profiling.

No analytics or ad networks: We have intentionally chosen not to integrate any analytics platforms, advertising networks, or social media widgets that would place third-party tracking cookies on your device.
cookies_services: Browser settings: Most browsers allow you to view, manage, and delete cookies through their settings menu. Look for "Privacy", "Security", or "Cookies" in your browser's preferences. Changes apply to all websites, not just this one.
Blocking all cookies: You can configure your browser to block all cookies. However, this may prevent the contact form and other essential features from functioning correctly.
Deleting cookies: You can delete all cookies stored by your browser at any time. On your next visit, the site will behave as if you are a first-time visitor.
Do Not Track: Some browsers send a "Do Not Track" signal. Since this website does not use tracking or analytics cookies, we effectively honour this preference by default.
Changes to this policy: We may update this cookie policy from time to time. Any changes will be posted on this page with an updated revision date. For questions, contact us at pardoal003@gmail.com.

accessibility_statement_desc:
Alon Pardo, Attorney at Law is committed to making this website accessible to all people, including people with disabilities, in accordance with the Equal Rights for Persons with Disabilities Act, 5758-1998, and the Equal Rights for Persons with Disabilities Regulations (Service Accessibility Adjustments), 5773-2013.
Last updated: February 2026  ·  Accessibility contact: pardoal003@gmail.com
accessibility_statement_scope: Standard & Law  ·  Accessibility Features  ·  Known Limitations  ·  Contact & Feedback
accessibility_statement_common_situation: WCAG 2.2 Level AA: This website strives to conform to the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.2 at Level AA, the internationally recognised standard for web accessibility. This level ensures that content is perceivable, operable, understandable, and robust for the widest possible audience.

Israeli accessibility law: In accordance with the Equal Rights for Persons with Disabilities Act (1998) and the Service Accessibility Regulations (2013), this website is designed to be accessible to people with a range of disabilities, including visual, auditory, motor, and cognitive impairments.

Israeli Standard IS 5568: The site is built in alignment with Israeli Standard 5568 (based on WCAG 2.0/2.1) as required by Israeli regulation for internet sites, which mandates Level AA compliance for service provider websites.

Ongoing commitment: Web accessibility is an ongoing effort. We regularly review and update this website to maintain and improve accessibility. We view accessibility not as a one-time project but as a core aspect of our digital presence.
accessibility_statement_what_to_do: Keyboard navigation: All interactive elements — links, buttons, form fields, and menus — are fully accessible via keyboard. Tab, Shift+Tab, Enter, and Escape work throughout the site.
Skip to content: A "Skip to main content" link is provided at the top of every page, allowing keyboard and screen reader users to bypass repetitive navigation.
Focus indicators: Visible focus outlines are displayed on all interactive elements when navigated via keyboard, ensuring users always know their current position on the page.
Colour contrast: Text and interactive elements meet WCAG 2.2 AA minimum contrast ratios (4.5:1 for normal text, 3:1 for large text). Colour is never used as the sole means of conveying information.

Semantic HTML & ARIA: The site uses semantic HTML5 elements (nav, main, footer, headings) and ARIA attributes where needed. Decorative images are marked with aria-hidden, and form fields include descriptive labels and required-field indicators.
Reduced motion: A prefers-reduced-motion media query is implemented, reducing or disabling animations for users who have set this preference in their operating system.
Bilingual support: The website supports both Hebrew (RTL) and English (LTR) with proper dir attributes, ensuring correct reading order and layout for both languages.
Responsive design: The site is fully responsive and functions on desktop, tablet, and mobile devices. Content reflows without horizontal scrolling at up to 400% zoom.
accessibility_statement_how_i_help: Third-party content: Some third-party services integrated into this website — including Google Fonts and WhatsApp (Meta) — operate under their own accessibility policies. We cannot guarantee full accessibility of content or interfaces provided by third parties.
Older browsers: Certain accessibility features may not function optimally on outdated browsers. We recommend using the latest version of Chrome, Firefox, Safari, or Edge for the best experience.
PDF documents: If any PDF documents are provided on this site in the future, we will make reasonable efforts to ensure they are accessible or provide alternative formats upon request.

Continuous improvement: Despite our best efforts, some areas of the site may not yet be fully accessible. We are actively working to identify and resolve any remaining barriers. If you encounter an issue, please let us know.
accessibility_statement_services: Report an accessibility barrier: If you encounter any difficulty accessing content or functionality on this website, we want to hear from you. Your feedback helps us improve.
How to contact us: Email pardoal003@gmail.com or call 052-420-3401. Please describe the accessibility issue, the page where it occurred, and the assistive technology you were using (if applicable).

Response time: We will acknowledge your feedback within 5 business days and make reasonable efforts to resolve the issue promptly. If a full resolution requires more time, we will provide you with an interim update and expected timeline.
Accessibility coordinator: Alon Pardo serves as the accessibility coordinator for this website. All accessibility inquiries and complaints are handled directly.

Filing a complaint: In accordance with Israeli law, if you believe your accessibility rights have been violated and your complaint has not been resolved satisfactorily, you may file a complaint with the Commission for Equal Rights of Persons with Disabilities at the Ministry of Justice (www.gov.il).
This statement: This accessibility statement was last reviewed in February 2026. We will update it as accessibility improvements are made or when relevant regulations change.
